greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Rebase n from 4 to 2. Replace 4^k with 2^k in quaternary expansion of n.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: a(n) = 2*a(n/4) if n == 0 (mod 4); otherwise, a(n) = a(n-1) + 1. - _Clark Kimberling_, Aug 03 2012
program: (PARI) Rebase(x, b, c)= { local(d, e=0, f=1); while (x>0, d=x-b*(x\b); x\=b; e+=d*f; f*=c); return(e) } { for (n=1, 1000, write("b065362.txt", n, " ", Rebase(n, 4, 2)) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Oct 17 2009
r end; [a(n) for n in 0:79] |> println # _Peter Luschny_, Jan 03 2021
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_, Oct 31 2001
